page.title: 16COUNTRY SPORTS - VIEW 2
page.content:
The term "sport" is not fitting for these sadistic pastimes. Sport implies fairness.
Consider a fox, its earth filled in, pursued by hounds and horsemen until the wretched animal drops from exhaustion, the shooting of birds and rabbits - for pleasure - not all killed cleanly but maimed and ignored. Local domestic cats may be used as target practice. Fishermen damage fish and cause the deaths of swans through careless use of lead weights. Foxhunters have little regard for property, damaging land, gates and fences, and their hounds invade gardens and savage domestic pets.
Those who participate in such events in the name of "sport" violate moral principles.
